intro: Perebea guianensis subsp. pseudopeltata, commonly known as the Guianan perebea, is a tropical tree native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its large, palmate leaves. The plant typically grows in humid, lowland forests and can reach heights of up to 30 meters. Its bark is thick and often has a rough texture, while its flowers are small and clustered. The subspecies is notable for its ecological role in supporting diverse wildlife in its native habitat.
